subject: AW: [patchmanagement] If not Ivanti, what?
email_text_original:
You don't often get email from juan.severino@skan.ch. Learn why this is
important [https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification] 
Hi, 
Yeah, that is my concern. Supply-chain attacks taking advantage of the
demonstrated poor security practices in that company. 
You all talk about funcitonality, but you are pushing patches packaged by Ivanti
or somebody's else like Chocolatey: Do you trust them? Are you unpackaging every
patch and analyzing what is inside of all deployment scripts? Are you blindly
installing software from Ivanti or any other automated patching tool using an
online repository of prepackaged patches? 
It is eventually a matter of trust. Security vs Convenience. 
Best regards. 
Seve 
Von: 'Dave Lum' via PatchManagement <patchmanagement@googlegroups.com>
Gesendet: Montag, 12. Februar 2024 21:57
An: patchmanagement@googlegroups.com
Betreff: RE: [patchmanagement] If not Ivanti, what? 
Our concerns are 100% driven by recent vulnerabilities found in *other* Ivanti
products and calls into question QA for all products under the Ivanti umbrella. 
I have used it since it was Shavlik then LANDesk then Ivanti.   I like the
product but management is treating it like “Well if the doors of the 737 blow
off mid-flight, how do I know the 777 and others aren’t affected?” 
I am not adverse to  submitting this reply as a reasonable rebuttal 
Dave
Link: https://groups.google.com/d/msgid/patchmanagement/DBBP189MB13405B628C4656AB021EC8D4E94F2%40DBBP189MB1340.EURP189.PROD.OUTLOOK.COM
